trans-unit.target: TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_SEQ_00<tab>For all his comforting words, Alphinaud is plainly troubled by Master Chai's sudden disappearance.
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_TODO_00<tab>Gather information in the Canopy.
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_TODO_01<tab>Gather information in the Buttress.
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_TODO_02<tab>Gather information in the Derelicts.
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_TODO_03<tab>Speak with Alphinaud.
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_KAISHIRR_000_000<tab>Y'know, Eulmore's nothing like I thought it'd be. But somehow, I can't picture going anywhere else.
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_KAISHIRR_000_001<tab>The Chais are part of it, I s'pose. They've been good to me. I only wish there was something more I could do to help them...
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_ALPHINAUD_000_020<tab>It makes no sense for Master Chai to have left without a word. But even if he had, he would not have done so unobserved.
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_ALPHINAUD_000_021<tab><var 1A 02 /var>Someone<var 1A 01 /var> here will have seen something. I am sure of it.

TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_ALPHINAUD_000_022<tab>We should split up and inquire as to whether anyone saw him leave or, failing that, if they have any idea where he might have gone. I will meet you at the Glory Gate to compare notes later on.

TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_ALPHINAUD_000_040<tab>It would seem Master Chai paid a visit to the Beehive before taking his leave of Eulmore. Unfortunately, the patrons I spoke with were too deep in their cups to remember aught else.
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_KAISHIRR_000_045<tab>...You ever get the feeling you're being watched? Ahh, I'm probably just imagining things.
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_SYSTEM_000_048<tab>You find a shoebill gazing in Kai-Shirr's general direction. Silent. Vigilant. Plotting...?
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_MOWEN_000_060<tab>Master Chai? Why yes, I spoke with him recently, though I recall he was in a rather dour mood. Concerned about Eulmore's neglect of industry, you see.

TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_MOWEN_000_061<tab>With Lord Vauthry's apparently inexhaustible stores of meol, and no great need for money, it's little wonder our businesses were all but forgotten under his rule.

TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_MOWEN_000_062<tab>But I assured Master Chai that the Boutique of Splendors will do all it can to contribute to the revival of trade here in Eulmore─which seemed to satisfy him. He took his leave soon after.
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_SYSTEM_000_063<tab>Your exchange with Mowen has taught you about “The stagnant state of business in Eulmore.”

TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_CORNENNE_000_070<tab>Looking for Master Chai, are you? Is something amiss? When last I saw him, he seemed ready to collapse from exhaustion. I insisted he rest and catch his breath, and we talked for a while─about his concerns over the city's defenses amongst other things.

TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_CORNENNE_000_071<tab>He made more than a few valid points. Many of our men are still recovering after your confrontation with Lord Vauthry, and finding General Ran'jit in a heap in the middle of the plaza shook us all to the core.
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_CORNENNE_100_071<tab>The man commanded no small amount of loyalty, and some of our longest-serving soldiers seemed lost without him. Indeed, a number of them left.
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_CORNENNE_000_072<tab>N-Not that we blame <var 1A 02 /var>you<var 1A 01 /var>, of course. Without you and yours, we would still be blind to the error of our ways.
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_CORNENNE_000_073<tab>Anyway...funding permitting, I proposed replenishing our ranks with volunteers from the Derelicts and Gatetown.

TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_CORNENNE_000_074<tab>We have a duty to protect not only Eulmore, you see, but the surrounding regions of Kholusia as well, and I for one would welcome any man or woman willing to take up arms for that cause. Indeed, I told him as much, and he seemed relieved to hear it. It was on that note that we parted ways. He headed outside, as I recall.
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_SYSTEM_000_075<tab>Your exchange with Cornenne has taught you about “The perilous state of Eulmore's defenses.”
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_HATHENBET_000_080<tab>Aye, I recall a man fittin' that description. Asked to speak with the poor buggers lately come from Wright.

TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_HATHENBET_000_081<tab>Said he wanted to know the state of things down in the Derelicts. And you can be sure we gave him an earful. Lack of food, medicine, clothin'─there was plenty to tell.

TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_HATHENBET_000_082<tab>We hunt high and low for whatever we can scavenge, and it's barely enough to fill our bellies. But folk here don't just want to survive, they want to thrive!
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_HATHENBET_000_083<tab>When he heard that, he started mumblin' to himself. Somethin' about findin' us work, I think.

TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_HATHENBET_000_084<tab>Fair play to him, though─not content with havin' his ear chewed about the Derelicts, he asked about the other settlements an' all. After that, I can't really say. Looked like he was headed for Gatetown when I last saw him.
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_SYSTEM_000_085<tab>Your exchange with Hathenbet has taught you about “The poor living conditions of Kholusia's downtrodden.”
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_MOWEN_000_090<tab>I know not what Master Chai is planning, but if he intends to bring business back to Eulmore, he has my wholehearted support.
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_CORNENNE_000_095<tab>Master Chai seemed genuinely concerned over our lack of numbers. Would that we had the money to hire more guards...
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_HATHENBET_000_100<tab>What? I told you everythin' I know. If you're after that Chai bloke, you won't find him here.
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_KAISHIRR_000_105<tab>Any luck? I got nowhere myself, but it sounds like Alphinaud might have.
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_ALPHINAUD_000_120<tab>Ah, there you are. How did you fare? Have you learned anything which might offer a clue as to Master Chai's whereabouts?
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_ALPHINAUD_000_121<tab>Interesting...
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_ALPHINAUD_000_122<tab>He apparently paid a visit to the Queen Bee as well.
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_ALPHINAUD_000_123<tab>They discussed the possibility of granting admission to customers from outside Eulmore, an idea to which the proprietor was surprisingly receptive.
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_KAISHIRR_000_124<tab>Sounds like he's got big plans for the place. Eulmore, I mean─not the Bee.
TEXT_LUCKMG106_03678_ALPHINAUD_000_125<tab>Perhaps. But the question remains─where did he go after leaving the city?
